snippet: Scorning critics of his friendliness with Moscow, President Demetris Christofias insisted that his country could take aid from whatever country it chooses, including Russia.
abstract: Cypriot Finance Min Vassos Shiarly criticizes European and international lenders, accusing them of damaging the nation's banking sector during the bailout of Greece; comments show Cypriot officials preparing to take a strong negotiating position with lenders ahead of talks on their own country's bailout.
lead_paragraph: Scorning critics of his friendliness with Moscow, President Demetris Christofias insisted that his country could take aid from whatever country it chooses, including Russia.

headline.main: Cyprus Leader Discusses Aid From Outside the European Union
headline.print_headline: Cyprus, Seeking Aid, Says Greek Bailout Damaged Banking Sector
